title: Letter Tile Possibilities
content:
You have n  tiles, where each tile has one letter tiles[i] printed on it.

Return the number of possible non-empty sequences of letters you can make using the letters printed on those tiles.

 

Example 1:

Input: tiles = "AAB"
Output: 8
Explanation: The possible sequences are "A", "B", "AA", "AB", "BA", "AAB", "ABA", "BAA".

Example 2:

Input: tiles = "AAABBC"
Output: 188

Example 3:

Input: tiles = "V"
Output: 1

 

Constraints:

  • 1 <= tiles.length <= 7
  • tiles consists of uppercase English letters.

codeSnippets.python3:
class Solution:
    def numTilePossibilities(self, tiles: str) -> int:
codeSnippets.elixir:
defmodule Solution do
  @spec num_tile_possibilities(tiles :: String.t) :: integer
  def num_tile_possibilities(tiles) do
    
  end
end

hints: Try to build the string with a backtracking DFS by considering what you can put in every position.
